articles.title: 'A manager's dream' - why Rice is the perfect midfielder
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Jermain Defoe praise the performance of Declan Rice, who scored two goals in Arsenal's 3-2 win over Bournemouth.

articles.title: How Wolves teenager Mane picked apart West Ham
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer breaks down teenager Mateus Mane's unstoppable performance against West Ham at home.

articles.title: Rice 'stretches himself to limit' before another 'masterclass'
articles.summary: How injury doubt Declan Rice "stretched himself to the very limit" to take Arsenal six points clear at the top of the Premier League.

articles.title: Rice strikes twice as Arsenal beat Bournemouth
articles.summary: Declan Rice scores twice, as Premier League leaders Arsenal come from behind to beat Bournemouth following early error.

articles.title: Amorim refuses to explain cryptic transfer comment
articles.summary: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim refuses to explain a cryptic comment about the club's transfer plans - hinting at friction behind the scenes.

articles.title: Six points clear but still 'more to come' from Hearts
articles.summary: After Hearts battled past Livingston to move six points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership, manager Derek McInnes says there is 'more to come' as new players arrive.

articles.title: Leeds v Man Utd - a rivalry that really matters
articles.summary: As Leeds aim to beat Manchester United in the Premier League for the first time since 2002, BBC Sport looks at their intense rivalry before Sunday's Elland Road meeting.

articles.title: Dyche wants perspective as Forest slump continues
articles.summary: A year after battling for a place in the Champions League, Nottingham Forest must ensure they avoid ending this season by sinking into the Championship.

articles.title: Wolves beat West Ham to earn first league win of season
articles.summary: Wolves secure a first Premier League win of the season at the 20th attempt as they make light work of fellow strugglers West Ham at Molineux.

articles.title: Brighton end winless spell with victory over Burnley
articles.summary: Brighton end their six-game winless run with a comfortable victory over struggling Burnley in the Premier League.

articles.title: Match of the Day
articles.summary: Highlights of four games on the first Saturday of 2026, including Bournemouth v Arsenal.

articles.title: Burnley lacked belief in defeat at Brighton - Parker
articles.summary: Burnley boss Scott Parker says his side "lacked belief" as they fall to their ninth defeat in 11 Premier League games at Brighton.

articles.title: 'I needed them and they were there' - when young players find new homes
articles.summary: BBC Sport explores how young footballers build bonds with second families when they leave home to sign for a new club on their path to the top.

articles.title: How Villa's midfield trio dominated Forest
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer analyses the performance Aston Villa's Youri Tielemans, Boubacar Kamara and John McGinn as the Villans returned to form with a dominant 3-1 win over Nottingham Forest.

articles.title: Rice and Gabriel character impresses Arteta
articles.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta praises Gabriel Magalhaes and Declan Rice's mentality, and says Arsenal showed maturity in their 3-2 win against Bournemouth at Vitality Stadium.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: 'Nothing he can't do!' - Is Littler on the cusp of invincibility?
articles.summary: Luke Littler was odds on favourite to lift the Sid Waddell Trophy again ahead of the 2026 World Darts Championship with an air of inevitability about his second world title.

articles.title: Littler opens up on 'special feeling' of going back to back at Worlds
articles.summary: Luke Littler has hailed the "special feeling" of joining an illustrious and short list of players who have gone back to back at the World Darts Championship.

articles.title: Littler thrashes Van Veen to retain World Darts Championship title
articles.summary: Luke Littler successfully defended his World Darts Championship title with a 7-1 thrashing of Gian van Veen in the final at Alexandra Palace.

articles.title: Demolition job! Littler dominates Van Veen (and wasp!) to retain title
articles.summary: Highlights of the World Championship final between Luke Littler and Gian van Veen.

articles.title: 'Reel it in, pal!' | Littler wins third set with The Big Fish!
articles.summary: Luke Littler won the third set of the World Championship final with this 170 finish.

articles.title: 'No one could stop him!' | Littler takes out 147 finish to go back-to-back!
articles.summary: Luke Littler wins the 2026 World Darts Championship with a stunning checkout.

articles.title: 'You never know when it ends, that's why it's special' | Mardle on Littler's back-to-back titles
articles.summary: Wayne Mardle says 'you just never know when it end, which is why this is so special' as he reflects on Luke Littler's back-to-back World Darts Championship titles.

articles.title: Iconic darts duo McDonald and Noble inducted into PDC Hall of Fame
articles.summary: Master of Ceremonies John McDonald and referee George Noble have been unveiled as the latest inductees into the PDC Hall of Fame ahead of both retiring follow the World Darts Championship.

articles.title: 'We are together with the board' - Nancy defiant after Celtic loss
articles.summary: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy insists he is still "together with the board" and believes "we can turn things around" despite falling to a sixth loss in eight games following the derby defeat to Ranger...

articles.title: Cold snap hits weekend EFL & National League games
articles.summary: Five of Sunday's League Two matches along with seven in the National League on Saturday postponed due to frozen pitches.
